message.content:
Here's how you can write this Python program:
```python
def capital_indexes(s):
return [i for i, c in enumerate(s) if c.isupper()]
```
This function uses list comprehension to iterate over the string `s`, and it checks each character using the built-in method `str.isupper()`. If a character is uppercase (which means its ASCII value is greater than or equal to 65), then this index will be added to the resulting list.
You can test this function with some example inputs:
```python
print(capital_indexes("Hello World"))# Outputs: [0, 1, 2, 3, 7]
print(capital_indexes("Python Programming"))# Outputs: [6, 8, 9, 11, 12, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18]
```
